multiple_choice.choice: specialized epithelial cells adapted to interact with blood
specialized connective tissue cells adapted to interact with blood
specialized nervous tissue cells adapted to interact with blood

response.feedback: Correct. Epithelial cells typically act as barriers. Endothelium acts as a barrier between blood and underlying tissues and cells.
Incorrect. Connective tissue typically adds strength and/or support to an organ. Endothelial cells do not provide much strength in blood vessels.
Incorrect. Endothelium are not nervous tissue, although they do have an ability to sense signals in their environment and communicate with neighboring cells.

part.hint: Consider the main function of each tissue category.
